all_paragraphs: Businesses are the leaders in the modern world. Cultures created and actions taken have an impact on the surrounding world. It is important to build with social impact in mind all the time. Act to have a positive impact on communities.

While discussing the future of business, we should understand the role of Gen X, Millenials, and Gen Z in the global economy. Over the next 30 years, an estimated $30 trillion of wealth will exchange hands from the baby boomers to Generation Xers and millennials. — Forbes August 2018

Gen X, Millennial, and Gen Z are working, building, and consuming. Gen X is in the age of highest earnings and consuming power. Millennials and Gen Z are coming fast behind. They account already for over half of the population, so they are winning with the quantity.

“Gen Z will comprise 32 percent of the global population of 7.7 billion in 2019, nudging ahead of millennials, who will account for a 31.5 percent share, based on Bloomberg analysis of United Nations data, and using 2000/2001 as the generational split.” — Bloomberg August 20, 2018.

The actions of Gen X, Millenials, and Gen Z strongly link to the success of your business. Gen X and Millennials caused us to start to consider the impact of consuming and working. They wanted to find ways beneficial for all of us. It has escalated into a movement. Gen Z is now highly aware of the surrounding world and the impact we have.

“The key factor that differentiated these two groups, other than their age, was an element of self-awareness versus self-centeredness,” according to “Rise of Gen Z: New Challenge for Retailers,” a report by Marcie Merriman, an executive director at Ernst & Young LLP. Millennials were “more focused on what was in it for them. They also looked to others, such as the companies they did business with, for solutions, whereas the younger people naturally sought to create their solutions.” — Bloomberg August 20, 2018.
There is a differentiation of people into groups. It’s a typical way of simplifying studies and researches. However, keep in mind all of us are individuals.
The data shows the trends arising and moving the whole world. Variables enable us to conclude and measure.

“Companies should be attuned to three implications for this generation: consumption as access rather than possession, consumption as an expression of individual identity, and consumption as a matter of ethical concern.” — McKinsey Nov 2018
It is easy to see from the changes in technology, politics, and business. There is a need for transformation towards transparency and honesty. The words are not enough.
“Why Label Transparency Matters When It Comes To Millennial Brand Loyalty” — Forbes 2017

“They know these YouTubers are paid, but the personal connection and transparency of the brand/celebrity interaction can offset any concerns marketers might have about using this tool. — Forbes July 23, 2018.
“Transparency In Business: 5 Ways To Build Trust” — Forbes April 3, 2019.

When connected to the online world, information flow is constant. Information and data are passing by. Younger generations are like agents with access to the knowledge earlier kept as a secret in business. Show an example and be worthy of your words. The message being, be honest.
Millennials Want Transparency and Social Impact. — Entrepreneur
Millennials vs. Gen Z: 5 Ways They’re Different: — Salesforce
“They may all look young. But Millenials and member of the subsequent Generation Z are markedly different in how they shop, interact with brands and view money” — Salesforce
Millennials reveal the top 100 brands they love — Businessinsider

Consumers can vote. They leave the businesses they don’t like. The best part of the Internet, your voice gets heard in a matter of minutes. An individual in distress of the impact of a particular business, shouts through social media. The result is often a mass inspection. Forced by the public to take action accordingly.
Make profit with impact in mind all the time. The data proves your impact as a business matter. It will keep you in business for years to come. Here is one word for you, Impact.
The Worst Social Media for Business Mistakes of 2019 (and What You Can Learn From Them) — Revive Social March 18, 2019
Top 25 Social Media Fails: The Worst Offenses on the Internet — How Sociable October 29, 2019

We require people to be kind and help each other. For businesses, the leaders in our global society, it’s more crucial. To add to it, governments and political actors seem to be losing interest as authorities increasing the leadership status as a business. The rise of technologies such as Bitcoin tells us that people are searching for worldwide communities. Bitcoin (a.k.a. cryptocurrency) is like a global community with values. Values like freedom, ownership of individual data, and open data. We see the rise of communities in which the borders of the countries doesn’t mean anything. On the other hand, people are following, for example, the actions of Facebook, Amazon, Apple, and all the corporations. People follow, discuss, and even justify their actions based on how corporations lead the way. For example, the recent law cases and noise around Facebook’s data usage tell us, the big companies are leaders and their actions matter. Well, social media platforms have even greater responsibility since what they present can affect people’s thoughts.

Governments and politics are losing some of the power for communities and corporations. All the noise around makes it clear, as a corporation, you are a leader. You affect the people more now when the world is connected. Be responsible. The future is demanding impactful business and investing from us.
